24#include <sys/cdefs.h>
25__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: nouveau_nvkm_engine_falcon.c,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:30 riastradh Exp $");
26
27#include <engine/falcon.h>
28
29#include <core/gpuobj.h>
30#include <subdev/timer.h>
31#include <engine/fifo.h>
32
33static int
34nvkm_falcon_oclass_get(struct nvkm_oclass *oclass, int index)
35{
36 struct nvkm_falcon *falcon = nvkm_falcon(oclass->engine);
37 int c = 0;
38
39 while (falcon->func->sclass[c].oclass) {
40 if (c++ == index) {
41 oclass->base = falcon->func->sclass[index];
42 return index;
43 }
44 }
45
46 return c;
47}
48
49static int
50nvkm_falcon_cclass_bind(struct nvkm_object *object, struct nvkm_gpuobj *parent,
51 int align, struct nvkm_gpuobj **pgpuobj)
52{
53 return nvkm_gpuobj_new(object->engine->subdev.device, 256,
54 align, true, parent, pgpuobj);
55}
56
57static const struct nvkm_object_func
58nvkm_falcon_cclass = {
59 .bind = nvkm_falcon_cclass_bind,
60};
61
62static void
63nvkm_falcon_intr(struct nvkm_engine *engine)
64{
65 struct nvkm_falcon *falcon = nvkm_falcon(engine);
66 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &falcon->engine.subdev;
67 struct nvkm_device *device = subdev->device;
68 const u32 base = falcon->addr;
69 u32 dest = nvkm_rd32(device, base + 0x01c);
70 u32 intr = nvkm_rd32(device, base + 0x008) & dest & ~(dest >> 16);
71 u32 inst = nvkm_rd32(device, base + 0x050) & 0x3fffffff;
72 struct nvkm_fifo_chan *chan;
73 unsigned long flags;
74
75 chan = nvkm_fifo_chan_inst(device->fifo, (u64)inst << 12, &flags);
76
77 if (intr & 0x00000040) {
78 if (falcon->func->intr) {
79 falcon->func->intr(falcon, chan);
80 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x004, 0x00000040);
81 intr &= ~0x00000040;
82 }
83 }
84
85 if (intr & 0x00000010) {
86 nvkm_debug(subdev, "ucode halted\n");
87 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x004, 0x00000010);
88 intr &= ~0x00000010;
89 }
90
91 if (intr) {
92 nvkm_error(subdev, "intr %08x\n", intr);
93 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x004, intr);
94 }
95
96 nvkm_fifo_chan_put(device->fifo, flags, &chan);
97}
98
99static int
100nvkm_falcon_fini(struct nvkm_engine *engine, bool suspend)
101{
102 struct nvkm_falcon *falcon = nvkm_falcon(engine);
103 struct nvkm_device *device = falcon->engine.subdev.device;
104 const u32 base = falcon->addr;
105
106 if (!suspend) {
107 nvkm_memory_del(&falcon->core);
108 if (falcon->external) {
109 vfree(falcon->data.data);
110 vfree(falcon->code.data);
111 falcon->code.data = NULL;
112 }
113 }
114
115 nvkm_mask(device, base + 0x048, 0x00000003, 0x00000000);
116 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x014, 0xffffffff);
117 return 0;
118}
119
120static void *
121vmemdup(const void *src, size_t len)
122{
123 void *p = vmalloc(len);
124
125 if (p)
126 memcpy(p, src, len);
127 return p;
128}
129
130static int
131nvkm_falcon_oneinit(struct nvkm_engine *engine)
132{
133 struct nvkm_falcon *falcon = nvkm_falcon(engine);
134 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &falcon->engine.subdev;
135 struct nvkm_device *device = subdev->device;
136 const u32 base = falcon->addr;
137 u32 caps;
138
139 /* determine falcon capabilities */
140 if (device->chipset < 0xa3 ||
141 device->chipset == 0xaa || device->chipset == 0xac) {
142 falcon->version = 0;
143 falcon->secret = (falcon->addr == 0x087000) ? 1 : 0;
144 } else {
145 caps = nvkm_rd32(device, base + 0x12c);
146 falcon->version = (caps & 0x0000000f);
147 falcon->secret = (caps & 0x00000030) >> 4;
148 }
149
150 caps = nvkm_rd32(device, base + 0x108);
151 falcon->code.limit = (caps & 0x000001ff) << 8;
152 falcon->data.limit = (caps & 0x0003fe00) >> 1;
153
154 nvkm_debug(subdev, "falcon version: %d\n", falcon->version);
155 nvkm_debug(subdev, "secret level: %d\n", falcon->secret);
156 nvkm_debug(subdev, "code limit: %d\n", falcon->code.limit);
157 nvkm_debug(subdev, "data limit: %d\n", falcon->data.limit);
158 return 0;
159}
160
161static int
162nvkm_falcon_init(struct nvkm_engine *engine)
163{
164 struct nvkm_falcon *falcon = nvkm_falcon(engine);
165 struct nvkm_subdev *subdev = &falcon->engine.subdev;
166 struct nvkm_device *device = subdev->device;
167 const struct firmware *fw;
168 char name[32] = "internal";
169 const u32 base = falcon->addr;
170 int ret, i;
171
172 /* wait for 'uc halted' to be signalled before continuing */
173 if (falcon->secret && falcon->version < 4) {
174 if (!falcon->version) {
175 nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
176 if (nvkm_rd32(device, base + 0x008) & 0x00000010)
177 break;
178 );
179 } else {
180 nvkm_msec(device, 2000,
181 if (!(nvkm_rd32(device, base + 0x180) & 0x80000000))
182 break;
183 );
184 }
185 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x004, 0x00000010);
186 }
187
188 /* disable all interrupts */
189 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x014, 0xffffffff);
190
191 /* no default ucode provided by the engine implementation, try and
192 * locate a "self-bootstrapping" firmware image for the engine
193 */
194 if (!falcon->code.data) {
195 snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "nouveau/nv%02x_fuc%03x",
196 device->chipset, falcon->addr >> 12);
197
198 ret = request_firmware(&fw, name, device->dev);
199 if (ret == 0) {
200 falcon->code.data = vmemdup(fw->data, fw->size);
201 falcon->code.size = fw->size;
202 falcon->data.data = NULL;
203 falcon->data.size = 0;
204 release_firmware(fw);
205 }
206
207 falcon->external = true;
208 }
209
210 /* next step is to try and load "static code/data segment" firmware
211 * images for the engine
212 */
213 if (!falcon->code.data) {
214 snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "nouveau/nv%02x_fuc%03xd",
215 device->chipset, falcon->addr >> 12);
216
217 ret = request_firmware(&fw, name, device->dev);
218 if (ret) {
219 nvkm_error(subdev, "unable to load firmware data\n");
220 return -ENODEV;
221 }
222
223 falcon->data.data = vmemdup(fw->data, fw->size);
224 falcon->data.size = fw->size;
225 release_firmware(fw);
226 if (!falcon->data.data)
227 return -ENOMEM;
228
229 snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "nouveau/nv%02x_fuc%03xc",
230 device->chipset, falcon->addr >> 12);
231
232 ret = request_firmware(&fw, name, device->dev);
233 if (ret) {
234 nvkm_error(subdev, "unable to load firmware code\n");
235 return -ENODEV;
236 }
237
238 falcon->code.data = vmemdup(fw->data, fw->size);
239 falcon->code.size = fw->size;
240 release_firmware(fw);
241 if (!falcon->code.data)
242 return -ENOMEM;
243 }
244
245 nvkm_debug(subdev, "firmware: %s (%s)\n", name, falcon->data.data ?
246 "static code/data segments" : "self-bootstrapping");
247
248 /* ensure any "self-bootstrapping" firmware image is in vram */
249 if (!falcon->data.data && !falcon->core) {
250 ret = nvkm_memory_new(device, NVKM_MEM_TARGET_INST,
251 falcon->code.size, 256, false,
252 &falcon->core);
253 if (ret) {
254 nvkm_error(subdev, "core allocation failed, %d\n", ret);
255 return ret;
256 }
257
258 nvkm_kmap(falcon->core);
259 for (i = 0; i < falcon->code.size; i += 4)
260 nvkm_wo32(falcon->core, i, falcon->code.data[i / 4]);
261 nvkm_done(falcon->core);
262 }
263
264 /* upload firmware bootloader (or the full code segments) */
265 if (falcon->core) {
266 u64 addr = nvkm_memory_addr(falcon->core);
267 if (device->card_type < NV_C0)
268 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x618, 0x04000000);
269 else
270 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x618, 0x00000114);
271 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x11c, 0);
272 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x110, addr >> 8);
273 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x114, 0);
274 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x118, 0x00006610);
275 } else {
276 if (falcon->code.size > falcon->code.limit ||
277 falcon->data.size > falcon->data.limit) {
278 nvkm_error(subdev, "ucode exceeds falcon limit(s)\n");
279 return -EINVAL;
280 }
281
282 if (falcon->version < 3) {
283 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0xff8, 0x00100000);
284 for (i = 0; i < falcon->code.size / 4; i++)
285 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0xff4, falcon->code.data[i]);
286 } else {
287 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x180, 0x01000000);
288 for (i = 0; i < falcon->code.size / 4; i++) {
289 if ((i & 0x3f) == 0)
290 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x188, i >> 6);
291 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x184, falcon->code.data[i]);
292 }
293 }
294 }
295
296 /* upload data segment (if necessary), zeroing the remainder */
297 if (falcon->version < 3) {
298 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0xff8, 0x00000000);
299 for (i = 0; !falcon->core && i < falcon->data.size / 4; i++)
300 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0xff4, falcon->data.data[i]);
301 for (; i < falcon->data.limit; i += 4)
302 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0xff4, 0x00000000);
303 } else {
304 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x1c0, 0x01000000);
305 for (i = 0; !falcon->core && i < falcon->data.size / 4; i++)
306 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x1c4, falcon->data.data[i]);
307 for (; i < falcon->data.limit / 4; i++)
308 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x1c4, 0x00000000);
309 }
310
311 /* start it running */
312 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x10c, 0x00000001); /* BLOCK_ON_FIFO */
313 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x104, 0x00000000); /* ENTRY */
314 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x100, 0x00000002); /* TRIGGER */
315 nvkm_wr32(device, base + 0x048, 0x00000003); /* FIFO | CHSW */
316
317 if (falcon->func->init)
318 falcon->func->init(falcon);
319 return 0;
320}
321
322static void *
323nvkm_falcon_dtor(struct nvkm_engine *engine)
324{
325 return nvkm_falcon(engine);
326}
327
328static const struct nvkm_engine_func
329nvkm_falcon = {
330 .dtor = nvkm_falcon_dtor,
331 .oneinit = nvkm_falcon_oneinit,
332 .init = nvkm_falcon_init,
333 .fini = nvkm_falcon_fini,
334 .intr = nvkm_falcon_intr,
335 .fifo.sclass = nvkm_falcon_oclass_get,
336 .cclass = &nvkm_falcon_cclass,
337};
338
339int
340nvkm_falcon_new_(const struct nvkm_falcon_func *func,
341 struct nvkm_device *device, int index, bool enable,
342 u32 addr, struct nvkm_engine **pengine)
343{
344 struct nvkm_falcon *falcon;
345
346 if (!(falcon = kzalloc(sizeof(*falcon), GFP_KERNEL)))
347 return -ENOMEM;
348 falcon->func = func;
349 falcon->addr = addr;
350 falcon->code.data = func->code.data;
351 falcon->code.size = func->code.size;
352 falcon->data.data = func->data.data;
353 falcon->data.size = func->data.size;
354 *pengine = &falcon->engine;
355
356 return nvkm_engine_ctor(&nvkm_falcon, device, index, func->pmc_enable,
357 enable, &falcon->engine);
358}
